Great plan. I’ll help you set up reminders and a fillable log that works on your phone. Here are concrete steps and options:

Reminders:
- Tonight: 8:00 PM to log urge/mood.
- Tomorrow morning: 6:30 AM to do 5-minute stretch + breakfast.

How to set:
- Google Calendar: Create two recurring events daily: "Log urge/mood" at 8:00 PM; "Morning stretch + breakfast" at 6:30 AM. Set notifications to alert at the time.
- If you prefer phone reminders, use your preferred app (Kakao, Samsung/Android reminders) with the same times and a quick message: "Log your urge/mood" and "Stretch + breakfast".

Fillable log template:
- Use this CSV template to import into Google Sheets (copy-paste or upload):
Date,Day,Time,UrgeLogged,CravingLevel,Triggers,Mood,FoodLogged,BreakfastPlan,StretchDone,Notes

Optional: A Google Sheet shareable template
- If you share your Google account email, I can draft and share a ready-to-use Google Sheet with dropdowns and data validation (UrgeLogged: Yes/No; CravingLevel: 0-10; etc.)

Printable PDF backup:
- I can provide a one-page printable PDF with the same fields if you’d like. Just say “PDF backup” and I’ll generate it.

Would you like me to draft a Google Sheet link for you now? If yes, tell me the preferred reminder times and your Google email (or I can provide a ready-to-import CSV).

agent_utterance:
Awesome plan. Here is a ready-to-import CSV template you can use tonight and tomorrow to log quickly on your phone. Copy the text, save as logs_template.csv, then import into Google Sheets.
Date,Day,Time,UrgeLogged,CravingLevel,Triggers,Mood,FoodLogged,BreakfastPlan,StretchDone,Notes
YYYY-MM-DD,Day,20:00,No,0,None,Neutral,No,Yogurt with berries,No,Evening log
YYYY-MM-DD,Day,06:30,No,0,None,Neutral,No,Eggs or yogurt,No,Morning log

How to use:
1) Save the above as a CSV file
2) In Google Sheets, File > Import > Upload > select Logs_template.csv
3) Choose to Insert new sheet or Replace current sheet

Printable PDF backup:
Date: __________  Day: __________  Time: __________
Urge Logged: ______  Craving Level (0-10): ______
Triggers: _______________________________
Mood: _________________________________
Food Logged: ______  Breakfast Plan: _____________
Stretch Done: ______  Notes: ________________________

agent_utterance:
Fantastic. Here’s an updated, low-effort logging setup. Use the CSV template below (ready to import into Google Sheets) and include a simple 'MissedLog' option and 'LogLaterTime' field. Then, you can create a Google Sheet from the CSV and generate a shareable link on your end.

CSV template (ready to import):
Date,Day,Time,UrgeLogged,CravingLevel,Mood,Triggers,FoodLogged,BreakfastPlan,StretchDone,MissedLog,LogLaterTime,Notes
YYYY-MM-DD,Day,20:00,No,0,None,Neutral,No,Yogurt with berries,No,No,,Evening log
YYYY-MM-DD,Day,06:30,No,0,None,Neutral,No,Eggs or yogurt,Yes,No,,Morning log

How to use:
- Save as logs.csv and import into Google Sheets (File > Import > Upload).
- Optional: In Sheets, add data validation for UrgeLogged (Yes/No) and CravingLevel (0-10).
- If you miss logging, set MissedLog to Yes and fill LogLaterTime with a preferred time to log later.
- For logging offline, you can print a PDF backup (see below).

Google Sheets link: I can’t generate a live link in-chat, but you can create one from the CSV and then share the link: File > Share > Get link. If you paste the link here, I can guide further setup (dropdowns, etc.).

Printable PDF backup: tell me if you want a printable one-page form and I’ll generate it.
